task.title: Configuring certificate profiles by using the
task.shortdesc: System administrators can configure certificate profiles by using the Security Settings page in the .

context.p: You can configure certificate profiles by using the , or by using . For more information about using to configure certificate profiles, see .
For more information about the components that you must specify when you configure certificate profiles, see .

step.cmd: Go to the Security Settings page in one of the following ways:

choices.choice: From the Home tab, click Server Security in the Secure your environment pane.
From the Server menu, click Security Settings.

step.cmd: Choose an action from the Certificate Profiles pane:

choices.choice: To add a certificate profile, click the Add icon.The certificate must be a PEM format certificate. The private key that is associated with the certificate must be an RSA private key.

To delete a certificate profile, select the profile and click the Delete icon.You cannot delete a certificate profile that is associated with a security profile. First, delete the associated security profile, and then delete the certificate profile.
To edit a certificate profile, select the profile and click the Edit icon.
